7. Test your RNN¶

To analyse the probability of apparition of a SMILES while using the RNN, you can use the script ‘tools/rnn_proba.py’.

You can use two functions

tools.rnn_proba.proba_different_smiles(model, smiles_to_test, verbose=False)[source]

Print the probability of apparition of the SMILES with the model given in parameter

Parameters:
  • model (Keras Model) – model to use
  • smiles_to_test (List[List[[str]]]) – list of SMILES to test
  • verbose (bool) – True : print all information of each turn, False : print only the probability
Returns:

None
tools.rnn_proba.proba_different_position(model, smiles_to_test, index, atom, verbose=False)[source]

Print the probability of apparition of a SMILES with different position of an atom

Exemple:
>>> proba_different_position(models[0],
>>>                          ['c', '1', 'c', 'c', 'c', 'c', '1', '\n'],
>>>                          [0, 2, 3, 4, 5], 's', False)
s1cccc1 : 0.00000000045901715348268789499561297600283699127388103
c1sccc1 : 0.00000000064832566091357019325257395698722251431433960
c1cscc1 : 0.00000001438888019436213103261810813092436145410601966
c1ccsc1 : 0.00000065275450335318335220226868345627657674867805326
c1cccs1 : 0.00000011832597629642405283315926981316246191511254437
Parameters:
  • model (Keras Model) – model to use
  • smiles_to_test (list of str) – list of SMILES to test
  • index (list of int) – index where the atom heve to be placed
  • atom (str) – atom to place
  • verbose (bool) – True : print all information of each turn, False : print only the probability
Returns:

None
